info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 5:44PM EDT until June 22 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHERN ARMSTRONG COUNTIES... At 544 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Ford City, or 7 miles northeast of Vandergrift, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Indiana, Vandergrift, Homer City, Apollo, New Kensington, Lower Burrell, Blairsville, Derry, Leechburg, Black Lick, North Apollo, and West Leechburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
